headline: B and L's Strawberry Smoothie
description: This strawberry smoothie recipe blends fresh strawberries, milk, yogurt, sugar, and vanilla for a tasty, icy treat. Great for breakfast, or anytime.

video.description: Fresh berries, skim milk, plain yogurt, and vanilla make a 5-star smoothie.
video.name: B and L's Strawberry Smoothie

name: B and L's Strawberry Smoothie

recipeInstructions.text: Combine strawberries, milk, yogurt, sugar, and vanilla in a blender. Add ice and blend until smooth and creamy.
Pour into glasses and serve immediately.

review.reviewBody: absolutely amazing!
So good! I used frozen strawberries & fr banana, omitting ice & subbed honey for sugar, whole milk & a bit more yogurt. Super creamy

Awesome! I doubled the recipe, used frozen strawberries, no ice, and vanilla yogurt and no vanilla extract, and 3 tbl of sugar. I've also added one banana to change the flavor a little. I've used frozen mangoes instead of strawberries, too. Quick, easy, and delish!
This smoothie was absolutely amazing! the strawberries were sweet so instead of 3 Tbs of sugar I added 2. It was really good and you could serve it with breakfast.
I tried this recipe out and it was one of the best smoothies ive ever made , this was so good but also easy and simple 5/5 .
I replaced skim milk with whole milk and used less yogurt

Wow this is delish! I tweaked it a little bit. I used 2% milk and instead of plain yogurt which I didn’t have at the time, I used what I had and grabbed the coconut yogurt that’s in the Chobani Flip Almond Coco Loco yogurt. That coconut really makes a difference and gives it an almost pina colada flavor. So good!! Try it!

Thanks so much B and L, Delicious and nutritious. I made this exactly as suggested, with Strawberry Kefir instead of skim milk and two scoops Vega Protein Made Simple vanilla flavored. Now back to my smoothie and blogging to help develop exceptional lives.

I've been looking at recipes for a strawberry smoothie and this one looked the best to me. And it did not disappoint! So yummy! Now I am really glad I cleaned and froze all those strawberries last year! Highly recommend!
It good
It was delicious! I didn’t use the yogurt because I didn’t have any but it was exquisite!

Yum! This recipe was absolutely amazing. At first I wondered why the servings were so small, but I figured it was because the finished product was particularly sweet (although I still gave myself 2 servings??). Topped it of with a bit of whipped cream, and served it up. Definitely a favorite of mine and highly recommended!

this was the absolute best smoothie I have ever made for my kids and then the next time I made it I tweaked a few ingredients instead of plain yogurt I use honey vanilla yogurt and I also added a banana to it and the kids love it just as much as the original recipe
Wow...
Anybody will try my strawberry milkshake to drink it

I drink smoothies everyday, in the morning and sometimes in the afternoon, to fill me up and also to prevent me from having junk food. I've tried various recipes and I must say, this one is delicious and so simple to make. I used Almond milk and no ice. It will be my breakfast from now on!!
This is super yummy!
This was really good! It reminded me of Orange Julius I only used 1 tsp vanilla though and used 2% milk. Husband was impressed and he’s not a fan of smoothies

FAVORITE SMOOTHIE EVER! this has been my go to smoothie for almost a year. it is delicious however for a healthier option i would add less sugar and vanilla. it tastes soooo good with pineapple and strawberry!
This recipe is delicious I dont like strawberries but I gave this recipe a try and I drank the whole thing in five minutes
DELICIOUS!!! My kids loved it too.
It tasted amazing. I used extra-vanilla Yogurt instead of plain and it tastes really good. 10/10. I made it at 1:30 AM so I'm surprised my parents didn't come downstairs.
it was ok added blueberrie
This was so good! I didn't add the sugar or vanilla extract because I already had some vanilla protein powder. I didn't think that strawberry vanilla would taste so good but I was so wrong!
This recipe is awesome! I used vanilla yogurt and whole milk. I think it made it a little sweeter.

I love this. I'm an over weight sugar addict that hates fruit. (or anything remotely healthy for me) I used low fat vanilla yogurt, skim milk, 1 tsp vanilla and added no sugar. I'm in love with this and so is my 12 year old daughter.
I added a splash of Jose cuervo blue agave and its absolutely Amazing
delicious! i also added mango.
Amazing and easy strawberry smoothie! This is seriously one of the easiest breakfasts ever. I substitute in Chobani Vanilla yogurt as well as almond milk and it is fantastic!
It was really good. I put vanilla flavored yogurt and didn't add vanilla to it. Best smoothie I've had in awhile.
really good
Super good. Use vanilla yogurt and there’s no need for vanilla extract.
This smoothie was BOMB!!! I loved it!! Totally going to make this again!!!
This was great but I suggest using frozen fruit no ice no vanilla and a little less sugar with I squirt of lemon juice
Yummy! I also used only 1 T of white sugar and 1t of vanilla. Perfect!
Yummy! I also used only 1 T of white sugar and 1t of vanilla. Perfect!
I loved the recipe. However I did add a pinch more of sugar, and a little bit more milk. Overall, I liked the recipe.
Added way more strawberries, like 12. Tastes less like yogurt and tastes more of strawberry.
yummy recipe.. will always do this from now on

Great easy recipe! Great for a summer treat. I used frozen strawberries and blueberries, and omitted the ice. I also used strawberry yogurt and added some honey to taste. The honey and vanilla extract really are the stars of this drink! Thanks for sharing!
Sooo good
A good simple recipe! Great treat for breakfast or any time of day!
My granddaughter loved this and she’s very picky. Great flavor. I didn’t use ice cubes - I used frozen strawberries so it didn’t dilute the flavor.

I will drop the vanilla down to one tsp. Skipped the sugar and used cool whip squirt bottle instead since my son wanted cool whip. i used frozen strawberries, and a banana. no ice. i used flavored yogurt and topped with more coolwhip. used a straw..
I add more milk and yogurt to make it more smoothie

This was so easy and delicious! The vanilla taste was strong. Next time I make it I will only use 1 teaspoon. It was also very watery and not thick or creamy. Maybe more yogurt? It was very good, and I will definitely make again!

I have made it twice and used 1% milk instead of skim milk and also used light vanilla yogurt instead of plain yogurt. Our 10 year old daughter won't normally drink healthy drinks but both times that I have made this she has wanted more.

I didn't add skim milk I actually added Whole milk. I didn't have 8 strawberries so I added 7. I also add 2 tbs of sugar instead of three. I do recommend to use vanilla Greek yogurt instead of plain Greek. I added one banana to add extra flavor and the normal amount of Vanilla. This is definitely the most amazing smoothie ever to be made! I highly recommend this to anybody! AMAZING!!
Awesome Smoothie I Have made at least 5 in the past 24 Hours totally addicted.
I used frozen strawberries so I eliminated the ice. It was awesome.
I did soy milk instead of skim milk it takes really good i will defonly make it again
We all love this recipe! I've made it exact and also made it by adding a banana along with everything else as written. From 4 year olds to 62 year olds and several in between, love it
This tasted delicious and my brother loved it too and he is very picky!
I made it with plain GREEK yogurt but it was probably one of the best smoothies I’ve ever tasted. Definitely making this again!

I added some cookies and cream protein powder, which was ever so noticeable in the final product. If I wasn’t trying to get a little extra protein I probably wouldn’t mess with any changes, because overall this is a very good recipe that came out with a good consistency and taste.
Delicious! My kids love it. I add 10-15 blueberries as well as a banana!
I used frozen strawberries instead. But so good!
Didn't have yogurt on me so i didn't use yogurt but still was delicious! The whole family liked it.
I will definitely make it again. I used frozen strawberries and I didn't add ice. I also added around a fourth cup of orange juice and a small amount of frozen raspberries.
it's SO good. if you want a thick smoothie use frozen strawberries and add a bit more ice. it's amazing!!
Very tasty and easy to make, highly recommend and will make again
I made no changes to the recipe, It was amazing as is. I would recommend it to anyone.
sooooo goooooood
I’m not a fan of smoothies but this is really good!
I did make one change, instead of sugar I put honey and I used this recipe for popsicles instead of smoothies. I thought they weren't too sweet and they were very refreshing.
It tasted really good!
It was so good... I loved the flavour but it only made half a cup for me :( but overall it was amazing!
I loved this recipe I added 3 extra strawberries and it tastes much better. I will definitely make this again.
I skipped vanilla extract and it still tasted good
Added a banana did not add sugar used whole milk and low-fat yogurt

Holy ! This thing is phenomenal! The only thing I didn't like was that there was too much yogurt taste at the end. I also added half a banana, and some blueberries. Once again, this thing is PHENOMENAL!!! Would recommend it to anyone in the world, even if they hate strawberries.
Add more strawberries! Put wet ingredients in first. Always!

i made this smoothie 3 difderent ways. i did the recipe as is the first time amd it was ok. my sister recommended vanilla yogurt and strawberry yogurt. both are delicious and i used freezer strawberries and bananas and its delicious. this recipe can be altered easily for your preference.
I did it without the milk since I didn't have any in the house and it was amazing definitely something I will drink again.
This was delicious! I cut the sugar to 1 tbs and the vanilla to 1 tsp. I also threw in a half of a frozen banana! I finally found my favorite smoothie recipe... thank you!
This is a great base for a smoothie. I took the suggestion of some the reviews to use vanilla yogurt and cut the sugar in half. It was awesome. Will use with other fruit in the coming days.

I don't swear very often but I'd feel perfectly justified using a curse word as an adjective to describe this smoothie. I never buy skim milk or plain yogurt so I used whole milk and strawberry Yoplait. My only complaint was that I had to share with others instead drinking it all myself...but that's not the recipe's fault. Five Gold Stars! Thank you!

I added 1/4 cup sugar to my 800 mL smoothie. I loved the ratio of milk yogurt and fruit. I doubled my ice cubes to 12 since I like mine a bit thicker. It was amazing and I'm definitely making this again!

This smoothie was AMAZING! I had some and shared the rest with my grandma and she loved it too! I would definitely recommend this to anyone that wants a healthy meal or snack. I would make this everyday if I could!
Quick, easy, and delicious. I used Stevia instead of white sugar.
I didn't make any changes, But next time I will try it with a few more strawberries, it lacked that strawberry flavor
If you do what it says, but use strawberry yogurt, it really brings out the strawberry flavor. But the recipe is all around great! Would definitely recommend with a little tweaks!
It is really good. I also added One scoop of vanilla protein powder and increase the milk to 3/4. Easy recipe to remember.
yes i did, i did not have any strawberries so i used mango chips and an extra tsp. of vanilla extract and it came out perfect, i love it thank you for the tips.
I added oatmeal! Held the vanilla and only half the sugar since I used peach yogurt!
I will Definitely make this again! So good
supper easy to make and a very simple recipe! No probs at all.
easy, quick, simple, and DELICIOUS!
Excellent! I’ve tweaked this recipe a couple of times by either adding a banana and less strawberries, and then using a protein powder smoothie instead of the milk. But it’s great just how it is.
Delicious!! I threw in a few extras; banana, apple, maple syrup and honey and added no sugar
Added a banana and used frozen strawberries. Delish.
Highly delicious! Sweet but not too sweet. Thick but not too thick. Even my husband who isn't a massive smoothie fan, liked this.
I used vanilla yogurt, no vanilla extract, and 2 tablespoons of sugar instead of 3. My daughter and wife said it was the best smoothie they have ever had. Recommended
Delicious! Used vanilla yogurt & 2 extra strawberries, and it is easily the best strawberry smoothie i've had to date.
Made it and loved it! My son is very picky and it’s a new favourite. The only change I made was using frozen berries.

I made this with 8 frozen strawberries, half a frozen banana, 1/2 cup unsweetened vanilla almond milk, 1/2 cup plain Greek yogurt, 1t vanilla, 2 packets of Truvia, and 1/2 cup water (since all my fruit was frozen). It's a lot of substitutions, but I wanted to make it healthier. It was amazing so I know it will taste amazing if you make it as written. Also, it was runny the way I made it, but I wanted to be able to down it quickly.
Super easy and good! My 8 year old made it. We also used vanilla yogurt and just 1tsp of vanilla.
amazing. I will make this again as soon as I get more yougurt. I do however prefer vanilla yougurt to plain. but still amazing
this is an amazing smoothie i did change it a little bit becouse i diden't add sugar instead i added a bannana!
